content:
Beef and Avocado Stuffed Bell Peppers are a flavorful and nutritious meal. Here are some side dish suggestions that would complement it well:

1. **Mexican Street Corn**: Grilled or boiled corn on the cob with mayonnaise, cotija cheese, chili powder, and lime juice is a classic Mexican side dish that pairs perfectly with the stuffed peppers.
2. **Cilantro Lime Rice**: A simple and flavorful rice dish made with cooked rice, chopped cilantro, lime juice, and a pinch of salt. It's a great way to soak up the juices from the peppers.
3. **Roasted Vegetables**: Roasted carrots, zucchini, or broccoli with a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper provide a nice contrast in texture and flavor to the soft peppers.
4. **Warm Flour Tortillas**: Serve warm flour tortillas on the side to use as a wrap or to mop up the juices from the peppers. You can also use them to make a makeshift taco with the leftover pepper filling.
5. **Mixed Greens Salad**: A simple green salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and a light vinaigrette dressing provides a refreshing contrast to the rich flavors of the peppers.
6. **Black Beans**: Simply cooked black beans with a sprinkle of cumin and lime juice can provide a plant-based protein boost to the meal.
7. **Grilled or Sautéed Greens**: Quickly cooked spinach, kale, or collard greens with garlic and lemon juice can add a burst of nutrients and flavor to the dish.

Choose one or two of these options to serve alongside your Beef and Avocado Stuffed Bell Peppers, and you'll have a well-rounded and delicious meal!
